location: England, Dorset, Dorchester, Maiden Castle Road
description: Two temple structures located in Maiden Castle hillfort, the earlier (1) is circular, and the later square temple (2), Lewis suggests to have been constructed in the early 3rd CE and have gone out of use in the early or mid 5th CE. Maiden Castle shows earlier use as a possible location for parts of the burial process, which may have some connection to the later temples.
bibliography: Russell, M., (2019), Mythmakers of Maiden Castle: Breaking the Siege Mentality of an Iron Age Hillfort, Oxford Journal of Archaeology, 38, 3, available at: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/10.1111/ojoa.12172

Booth, T., Madgwick, R., (2016), New evidence for diverse secondary burial practices in Iron Age Britain: A histological case study, Journal of Archaeological Science, 67, pg. 14â€“24, available at: http://dx.doi.org/10.1016/j.jas.2016.01.010
Martyn, Blick, Brindle, et al, (2015), Maiden Castle (Dorset), available at: https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449
Sharples, (1991), Maiden Castle: excavations and field survey 1985-6 (1991), nglish Heritage Archaeological Report, no. 19
Toynbee, J., (1909), in Art in Roman Britain
